intro: Dombeya selinala, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments in the understory of forests. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a velvety texture.
